meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of saprobes.
meanings.sent1: The saprobic fungi play a vital role in breaking down dead plants.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the saprobic behavior of certain bacteria.
meanings.sent3: The saprobic mushrooms had a party in the compost pile.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was as saprobic as the fungi in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The smell of decay was a clear sign of the saprobic process at work.

meanings.definition: Organisms that obtain nutrients from decaying organic matter.
meanings.sent1: The saprobic in the soil help recycle nutrients.
meanings.sent2: A biologist studies the role of saprobic in ecosystems.
meanings.sent3: The saprobic threw a feast on the fallen leaves.
meanings.sent4: The saprobic were like tiny cleaners of the forest floor.
meanings.sent5: The presence of saprobic indicated a healthy decomposition cycle.
